poem:
Strictly Here and Now

Under glittering sphere, the dreamers prepare,  
heels click against time's polished floor.  
Nitro's pecs drum a beat, distracting eyes,  
as partners pair with faith and flair.  
The word's on the cusp, "Bosh!" in the air,  
a dance of hope, twirl and declare—  
rhythms of the heart come alive tonight.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Strictly Come Dancing: the launch show – live 8.04pm BST Couples on the couch La Winkle and Dame Daly make chit-chat with another batch of hoofing novices. Nitro from Gladiators jiggles his pecs, distractingly. 7.59pm BST I fear we’re about to hear the word “Bosh!” rather a lot. Arguably too much. 7.58pm BST Final five couples about to drop We can probably have a good guess at them by process of elimination but let’s not". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
